reviews.text: As a member of a commercial cycling tour, we spent two nights at this high end resort with the cost of lodging buried in the total package price. The resort is located a few hundred feet above Lake Geneva creating a magnificent vista for sunrises. The grounds and gardens are grand and well tended. The service and dinning was respectable and professional. The hotel seemed a bit empty but this might have something to do with its high end prices during a global recession. If one cycles there are many day by day tour options to choose from in exploring the local mountains and villages. I admit that I would be unlikely to pay the prices asked if traveling on my own or with family.
reviews.title: Nice place, great grounds, incredible views, big bucks

reviews.text: We stayed at the Royal Evian for 3 nights over New Year 2009/2010. The Royal was celebrating their 100 birthday. I am sure that this hotel was quite spectacular when it was younger. However, the rooms are very old and haven't really been refurbished. The service was good by European standard but by Asian standard quite average. Their buffet room essentially served the same food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Evian over the Christmas/NY break is very quiet so most restaurants were not open and as a result we ate in the Buffet room alot because it was the cheapest of the restaurants at the Royal. The hotel is very overpriced for what you get. We also stayed at the Hilton in Evian which we found to be far better value for money.
reviews.title: Very overpriced and only if you like old hotels

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel with our young baby for a few nights in March 2010. The view over the lake is magnificient and the hotel still retains the old grandeur minus the glamour. I really do not agree with the 5 star rating apart from the lake view. Accomodation and service is pretty much 3 stars. On top of that, our experience was terrible as both my husband and I both got food poisoning on the second night after eating the hotel's food exclusively. We were either in bed or on the bathroom floor for the next 24 hours. We were with our 5 month old baby who I could not breastfeed anymore because of my ilness, when I finally did try to feed him, my baby threw up as well. We asked the concierge to call a doctor for us, who never arrived. We complained the 3rd day when we finally could be on our feet again and they offered us the meal that poisoned us free of charge. Just terrible!
reviews.title: Food poisoning for free!

reviews.text: i am basically a solo traveller when it comes to luxury properties and i stayed there for one day in october 2009. well the property was not as huge as my expectation but i was overwhelmed by thier courtaeous service and facilities. the concierge was very helpful and thier spa facilities were specatacular.of course its very expensive and i did realise it was not complete value for money .
reviews.title: destressing and rejuvenating

reviews.text: the cuisine was just ok, maybe the chef could nt really prepare something vegetarian for me. for asolo woman traveller i ll definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Wonderful quality time with my daughter!

reviews.text: The hotel is situated above Evians-les-bains with wonderful views. It is a majestic old building but in tip top condition. The infinity pool is idyllic as are the extensive grounds. The hotel encourages children to make full use of the children's club/pool/restaurant, sadly some parents blissfully ignored these requests which was a bit annoying for those looking for some peace and quiet. Another point to note is that only some rooms are air conditioned which is not made very clear when booking on line. Service was good and the spa was nice.
reviews.title: Grand Old Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at Evian Boat station and found by ourselves that there actually was a shuttle to come up to the hotel (this was not advised of at the time of the reservation).We arrived with my wife at 3 pm. The reception clerk was busy with another person, but did not even acknowledge us. Upon check-in we were advised that our room was not ready and we were offered to wait at the lounge. Half an hour later we were escorted to our room with a tour of the hotel. We were advised that we were upgraded to a larger room.
reviews.title: terrible rooms in very bad state

reviews.text: When we arrived in the room, to our surprise it was really not up to "leading hotels" standards. The room was indeed spacious, but in a bad state of disrepair. There were scuffs on several walls, the furniture was in a bad state, there was left over baby food from the previous clients in the minibar, the floor in the bathroom was badly stained (please see attached pictures), the bed skirt was stained.
reviews.title: Overrated with arrogant service, outdated accomodations. View spectacular ! Way Overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We asked the receptionnist if any newer rooms were available, to which the receptionnist kindly went to check. We were then offered different rooms of a higher category providing we would pay an extra 100 or 200 euros depending on the room.
reviews.title: Pleasant room with glorious view.

reviews.text: We received excellent treatments at the spa and had a good dinner with great service at the restaurant in the evening.
reviews.title: Felt like royalty at the Royal!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have been in the Hotel Royal Resort in Evian-les-Bains for 5 days and can only say, that it is one of the most beautiful hotels we ever stayed in. The view on the wonderfull lake, the mountains in the back, gardens like in the best golf courses and the rooms, service and restaurants - just perfect. This is not "only" 5 stars, it is a hotel like in a fairy tale of highest class, style, service and with heart.
reviews.title: Like in a Fairy Tale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Positives - beautiful view, we had a nice room with more then adequate space, room attendants were good, restaurant staff nice but not enough staff/guests, kids club very nice, pool facilities good, spa was excellent (very professional, on time). Kids meal was amazing - three course meal, nice selections and very much exceeded our expectation for the value (15euros). That was one of the few positives.
reviews.title: Hotel does not meet expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives - many errors on our bills, service slow (they appeared to be very short on staff and the hotel was full), errors on meals with menu service, only options for family was buffet, food was good but cold or barely warm at best. Tried to bill us for 3rd kid on check out even though I was told that it was acceptable when I made reservations to have 3 kids and kids were to stay free (as per buyclub.ch). Last of all, we were on a voucher that allowed us to stay for 1/2 price. They made point a couple of times about us being there on a "coupon" which appeared to give them some excuse for poorer service. I get it that we didn't pay full price and that the hotel would like cater to the full fare guests first but to make it a point throughout our stay was very unprofessional and strange - especially for a hotel of that caliber. However, even if we did pay full price I am not sure if the service was much better. For example, there was no staff working the exterior area on a beautiful sunny day. People had to go inside and find someone to bring drinks and it took forever. We had lunch and then went back later for coffee. We waited 45 minutes and were never waited on.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent a beautiful weekend with my wife there. The room was very large with lake view. Although obviously not the latest renovation, but quite charming. The stuff was very polite and helpful. My wife and myself have quite demanding tastes as for the food is concerned, and both of us were pleasantly impressed but the great variety of possibilities for breakfasts, lunches and dinners. We completely forgot about the bad weather last weekend while enjoying the hotel's SPA center. Would recommend the place to everyone, who wants to get lost in relaxation away from everyday routine.
reviews.title: Royal treatment at the Royal in Evian

reviews.text: Beautiful castle hotel at the border of Lake Geneva. Stately but pricy rooms, although they have intersting packages e.g. ski packages.
reviews.title: Memorable stay

reviews.text: I spent 2 days in this hotel with a big group of colleagues. I must say the setting is great, the hotel building and its grounds very well taken care of and the staff are very polite and attentive. Everything was running smoothly, from the conference room setting to coffee breaks to dinner-party organization.
reviews.title: Pure luxury and relaxation in a great setting

reviews.text: The hotel has lovely looking spa facilities, unfortunately I did not have the chance to use them. The rooms are spacious, so was my bathroom. Room service was very attentive, I would say even too attentive as they could knock on my door 3 times per day, and believe me, I didn't spend much time in the room. I actually found it pretty annoying in a hotel of this class. The food was great both at breakfast and at dinner with a rich choice.
reviews.title: Fairy tale Hotel with unaceptable problems for its rate!

reviews.text: So if you are looking for a very relaxing stay in Evian, with great views on Geneva lake and away from everyday turmoil Evian Hotel Royal is just the place to stay in.
reviews.title: A good option to get away from it all

reviews.text: I couldn´t acess the internet from my Laptop in the hotel during my 5 day stay. The concierge told me everytime that the problem would be solved on the next day, but it was clear that they haven´t got a good technician in the team. I also complained that I wasn´t able to acess the pay tv to hire movies, but left the hotel without having my problems solved.
reviews.title: Great gem of a hotel for families but beware hard to feed kids early dinner here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service quality was incompatible with a Leading Hotel of the World rated hotel and the price we payed.
reviews.title: Very disappointing
